meanings.definition: An electronic device that amplifies weak signals before they are sent to a main amplifier.
meanings.sent1: The preamp boosted the faint sound from the microphone.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to connect the preamp before the main amplifier for better sound quality.
meanings.sent3: The preamp whispered to the main amplifier, 'I'll make you sound louder!'
meanings.sent4: Like a detective magnifying clues, the preamp enhanced the audio signals.
meanings.sent5: The preamp acted as a secret agent, strengthening the signals before they reached the big boss amplifier.

meanings.definition: To amplify a weak signal before it is sent to a main amplifier.
meanings.sent1: She preamps the guitar before every performance to ensure a clear sound.
meanings.sent2: Remember to preamp the microphone before connecting it to the main system.
meanings.sent3: He preamps the audio like a chef adding the perfect seasoning to a dish.
meanings.sent4: The preamp works its magic, turning whispers into booming voices.
meanings.sent5: Preamping the signal is like giving it a power-up before the big show.
